original_definition: 'auxiliary energy' means the energy used by an ambient controlled anti-condensation heater, expressed in kWh/a.
generated_definition: 'auxiliary energy' means devices or functions other than ambient controlled anti-condensation heaters used to provide additional heating or cooling to a building or space.

Article 2:
‘auxiliary energy’ (Eaux
) means the energy used by an ambient controlled anti-condensation heater, expressed in kWh/a.
